title: Strict action against drivers of vehicles with unauthorized modifications starting today
byline: The strict enforcement of laws against drivers operating vehicles with dangerous and unauthorized modifications will begin today (September 8), according to Deputy Minister of Transport Dr. Prasanna Gunasena.

title: Showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at several places in Northern, North-Central, Eastern, Central, Sabaragamuwa and Uva provinces and in Kurunegala and Hambantota districts after 1.00 p.m.  today (08), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: After issuing ‘last warning’ to Hamas, Trump eyes Gaza deal ‘soon’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday suggested a Gaza deal could come soon to secure the release of all the hostages held by Hamas, after earlier issuing what he called his “last warning” to the Palestinian militant group.

title: Two suspects arrested over Grandpass shooting incident
byline: Two suspects have been apprehended in connection with the recent Grandpass shooting incident that claimed the life of one individual on the night of September 5.

title: Another stock of chemicals used in manufacturing ‘Ice’ found in Kandana
byline: Police have detected another stock of chemicals, similar to the stock recovered in Middeniya and suspected to be used in the manufacturing of crystal methamphetamine (ICE), at a residence in Kandana.

title: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister to deliver statement at 60th UNHRC session today
byline: The 60th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) commences today (8) in Geneva and will continue until October 8.

title: Two suspects arrested with 83 passports in Ganemulla
byline: Two suspects, including a woman, have been arrested in the Horagolla area of the Ganemulla Police Division for the illegal possession of 83 passports belonging to various individuals.

title: UNHRC Resolution: Will India, South Africa and Japan back Sri Lanka?
byline: The 60th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council will be extremely decisive for Sri Lanka, former Commissioner of the Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka Attorney-at-Law Prathibha Mahanamahewa stated.

title: Ariana Grande, Lady Gaga land top honors at MTV’s Video Music Awards
byline: Pop singer Ariana Grande claimed the top prize at the MTV Video Music Awards, and Lady Gaga and Sabrina Carpenter scored major honors, at a star-studded celebration of fan favorites in New York on Sunday.

title: Apple iPhone 17 Pro Max — Top 10 Features
byline: Arguably the biggest tech launch of 2025 — Apple’s iPhone 17 — is a day away, and one of the devices expected to take spotlight is the iPhone 17 Pro Max.

title: Petitions challenging ex-President Ranil’s move to appoint Deshabandhu Tennakoon as IGP to be heard next year
byline: The Supreme Court has scheduled February 12, 2026 for the hearing of petitions challenging the constitutionality of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s decision to appoint Deshabandhu Tennakoon as Inspector General of Police (IGP).

title: Former MP Nimal Lanza arrested over assault incident granted bail
byline: Former Member of Parliament Nimal Lanza, who was arrested by the Kochchikade Police over an assault incident and subsequently remanded by court, has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Suspected terror attack at entrance to Jerusalem, some 15 injured by gunfire
byline: Medics are treating some 15 victims who were injured by gunfire in a suspected terror attack at the Ramot Junction entrance to Jerusalem, says the Magen David Adom ambulance service.

title: President’s Fund to award scholarships for children of Sri Lankans affected abroad
byline: The President’s Fund has announced plans to implement a scholarship program to safeguard the education of children residing in Sri Lanka whose parents working abroad have died, become disabled, or gone missing due to various circumstances.

title: UNP agrees to work with SJB constructively in future
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has decided to continue engaging cooperatively with the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) and other opposition political parties, in accordance with the consensus reached during initial discussions.

title: Yen slides after Japan PM Ishiba resigns, dollar wobbles
byline: The yen fell sharply on Monday following the resignation of Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, while the dollar remained on shaky footing after Friday’s weak U.S. jobs report cemented expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut this month.

title: “Let’s Return Kala Wewa to the Elephants” project conducted
byline: The project titled ‘Let’s Return Kala Wewa to the Elephants’, as part of the ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative, has been carried out in the floodplain areas of the Kala Wewa National Park.

title: Disciplinary inquiry underway against Dr. Palitha Rajapaksha over comments on medicine shortage
byline: Dr. Palitha Rajapaksha from Badulla Teaching Hospital has been summoned before the Public Service Commission for a disciplinary inquiry.

title: Tesla market share in US drops to lowest since 2017 as competition heats up
byline: Tesla’s U.S. market share dropped to a near eight-year low in August as buyers chose electric vehicles from a growing stable of rivals over the aging lineup offered by CEO Elon Musk’s company, according to data from research firm Cox Automotive shared exclusively with Reuters.

title: Wealthy ancient Roman’s tomb discovered in Albania
byline: Archaeologists in Albania have discovered a large Roman burial chamber dating from the third to fourth century AD, the first of its kind found in the Balkan country that was once part of the Roman Empire.

title: Ex-State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera, who was arrested and remanded for allegedly selling a plot of state-owned land in Kiribathgoda to a private party by forging documents, has been further remanded.

title: “Harak Kata” to remain in custody under PTA until trial ends – AG Informs court
byline: Nadun Chinthaka Wickramaratne, also known as “Harak Kata”, an underworld figure linked to large-scale drug trafficking, is to remain in custody under the PTA until the conclusion of legal proceedings, as per a detention order issued by the Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, the Attorney General informed the Colombo High Court today.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka surge by around Rs. 5,000 today
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have increased by approximately Rs. 5,000 today (08).

title: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka surpass 1.6 million in 2025
byline: The number of tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka so far in 2025 has surpassed 1.6 million.

title: CEB workers threaten to intensify trade union action if demands are not met
byline: The Sri Lanka Nidahas Sewaka Sangamaya of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) claims that the government has not yet paid any attention to the ongoing work-to-rule campaign initiated by CEB workers.

title: Five killed in Jerusalem shooting attack, paramedics say
byline: Five people have been killed and seven seriously wounded in a shooting attack by Palestinian gunmen in Jerusalem, paramedics and police say.

title: UN Rights Chief presents report on Sri Lanka at Human Rights Council
byline: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk has presented the report of the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights to the 60th session of the UN Human Rights Council.

title: Police equipment used for official duties found on land in Middeniya
byline: Equipment used by officers in field operations, along with items resembling official police uniforms have been found buried on a plot of land in Middeniya, where chemicals believed to be imported for the production of ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) were previously discovered, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka committed to accountability process only through domestic mechanisms: FM tell UNHRC
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath says Sri Lanka rejects any external interference or mechanisms to investigate alleged human rights violations that occurred during the conflict with the LTTE.

title: At least 10 killed, several injured as Nepal youths clash with police during protest against social media ban
byline: At least 10 people were killed and several injured on Monday as Nepal police fired tear gas and water cannon to disperse demonstrations led by youths against a government ban on social media sites in Kathmandu.

title: Colombo Range DIG Uditha Liyanage further remanded
byline: The Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of the Colombo Range, Uditha Liyanage who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with allegations of aiding and abetting illegal treasure hunting, has been further remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Appeals for re-scrutiny of 2025 Scholarship Exam results accepted from tomorrow
byline: The process for submitting appeals for the re-scrutiny of the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination results will begin tomorrow (09).

title: Derailment disrupts train services on Kelani Valley line
byline: The Department of Railways stated that a train travelling from Colombo to Avissawella has derailed between Puwakpitiya and Avissawella railway stations this evening (8).

title: Facebook, WhatsApp, X: List of 26 Apps banned in Nepal
byline: Nepal has banned 26 social media and communication platforms after they failed to register with the government under new social media regulations.

title: Driver’s negligence caused Ella bus accident: Police
byline: Last week’s bus accident on the Ella–Wellawaya road occurred due to the negligence of the driver, according to Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Traffic, Indika Hapugoda.

title: Suspect arrested for filming Chief Justice’s vehicle convoy remanded
byline: An individual who allegedly filmed the vehicle convoy of the Chief Justice has been remanded until September 10, Ada Derana reporter said.
